TELNET_EXPOSED.title: Telnet Service Exposed
TELNET_EXPOSED.description: Telnet service is running without encryption, transmitting credentials and data in plaintext.
TELNET_EXPOSED.danger: Attackers can intercept credentials and gain unauthorized access to the device.
mitigation_steps: Disable Telnet service immediately
Enable SSH service as secure alternative
Configure strong authentication for SSH
Implement network segmentation to isolate IoT devices
Monitor for unauthorized access attempts
references: CIS Controls v8: Control 4 - Account Management

HTTP_INSECURE.title: Insecure HTTP Service
HTTP_INSECURE.description: Web interface accessible via unencrypted HTTP protocol.
HTTP_INSECURE.danger: Credentials and sensitive data transmitted in plaintext can be intercepted.
mitigation_steps: Configure HTTPS with valid SSL/TLS certificates
Redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS
Disable plain HTTP access if not required
Implement certificate pinning
Regularly update SSL/TLS configurations
references: OWASP Transport Layer Protection Cheat Sheet

CAMERA_RTSP_OPEN.title: Unsecured Camera RTSP Stream
CAMERA_RTSP_OPEN.description: RTSP streaming service is accessible without authentication.
CAMERA_RTSP_OPEN.danger: Unauthorized users can view camera feeds and potentially control the device.
mitigation_steps: Enable strong authentication for RTSP streams
Change default credentials immediately
Restrict RTSP access to specific IP ranges
Implement network segmentation
Consider disabling RTSP if not essential
Regular firmware updates

MQTT_NO_AUTH.title: MQTT Broker Without Authentication
MQTT_NO_AUTH.description: MQTT messaging service allows anonymous connections.
MQTT_NO_AUTH.danger: Anyone can publish/subscribe to topics, potentially controlling devices or stealing data.
mitigation_steps: Enable MQTT authentication with strong passwords
Implement client certificate authentication
Restrict broker access to trusted networks
Use MQTT over TLS (mqtts)
Monitor for unauthorized client connections
Implement proper topic access controls

UPNP_ENABLED.title: UPnP Enabled on Device
UPNP_ENABLED.description: Universal Plug and Play protocol is active, allowing automatic port forwarding.
UPNP_ENABLED.danger: Can expose internal services to the internet without user knowledge.
mitigation_steps: Disable UPnP in device settings
Manually configure port forwarding when needed
Implement strict firewall rules
Regular network monitoring for unexpected port mappings
Network segmentation of IoT devices

OUTDATED_FIRMWARE.title: Outdated Firmware Detected
OUTDATED_FIRMWARE.description: Device is running older firmware version with known vulnerabilities.
OUTDATED_FIRMWARE.danger: Known security flaws may allow exploitation or compromise.
mitigation_steps: Check manufacturer website for latest firmware
Download and install firmware updates immediately
Enable automatic update checking if available
Test updates in non-production environment first
Maintain inventory of device firmware versions

WEAK_SSH_CONFIG.title: Weak SSH Configuration
WEAK_SSH_CONFIG.description: SSH service configured with weak security settings.
WEAK_SSH_CONFIG.danger: Vulnerable to brute force attacks and unauthorized access.
mitigation_steps: Disable password authentication, use key-based auth
Change default SSH port from 22
Implement fail2ban or similar intrusion prevention
Restrict SSH access to specific IP addresses
Disable root login via SSH
Use strong SSH key pairs (4096+ bits)

DEFAULT_CREDENTIALS.title: Default Credentials Detected
DEFAULT_CREDENTIALS.description: Service appears to be using manufacturer default login credentials.
DEFAULT_CREDENTIALS.danger: Well-known default passwords make unauthorized access trivial.
mitigation_steps: Change all default usernames and passwords immediately
Use strong, unique passwords for each device
Implement password policies (length, complexity, expiration)
Consider password managers for credential storage
Disable unused accounts and services
